result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos M Ospina

records.addlTxt:
8:30 AM Defendant Carlos M Ospina in court.  Attorney Brian P Dimmer in court for Carlos M Ospina.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Defense provided the State with additional materials.  Parties ask for a jury trial.  All Motions in Limine, Witness lists, Proposed Jury Instructions and changes to the Substantive Jury Instructions are due 48  hours before the Final Pretrial.  Parties are to check for witness availability for this scheduled trial date and inform the Court of any problems.
Jury trial scheduled for February 28, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Final pre-trial on February 13, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial on February 28, 2023 at 08:30 am.

8:49 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Carlos M Ospina in court.  Attorney Brian P Dimmer in court for Carlos M Ospina. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  Defense has not met with the State to negotiate.  Defense has reviewed the digital discovery.  Defense is still waiting on reports.  Defense has provided the State with private investigator reports.  Parties ask for one last status.
Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:04 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Carlos M Ospina in court.  Attorney Brian P Dimmer in court for Carlos M Ospina. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  Deft. has tested negative at RCAP this morning.  Defense has provided the State with new information and an investigative report.  Parties ask for another status.
Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
DA Autho to Def re Electronic Evidence
NG plea entered.

8:38 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Carlos M Ospina in court.  Attorney Natalie L. Wisco in court for Carlos M Ospina. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with child S.G, and G.O. No violent contact with the victim M.O (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

*Amended 3/23/22* Defendant may have contact with G.O.

8:40 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Carlos M Ospina in court.  Attorney Brian P Dimmer in court for Carlos M Ospina. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense requests to adjourn the prelim, they were just recently retained. Requests bond be heard.
Victims mother appears, requesting contact between defendant and child victim G.O. Defense indicates defendant and family are working with CPS.
State objects to any bond modification.

BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits for holding a preliminary hearing. Bond motion is granted to allow contact with G.O
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:49 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Carlos M Ospina appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez for Carlos M Ospina appeared by video. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
